page.title: 10WATERFORD MARSH
page.content: Waterford Marsh is one of the most attractive places on the North side of Hertford. With the River Beane meandering through it is popular for walks, in spite of the fact that it is waterlogged during periods of wet weather. There is an abundance of animal and bird life on the marsh. The most noticable birds are the aggressive Mute Swans, Moorhens and the Grey Heron. Rabbits have colonised the railway embankment in large numbers and are much in evidence. An interesting new feature of the Marsh is the Tree Nursery which opened a couple of years ago. This is situated between the North bank of the Beane and the Stevenage road.
